Waypoints.Name: HGSOC
Waypoints.Description: Due to symptom presentation of High Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer (HGSOC) being characteristic of many other conditions it is often detected at late stage. Because of this, the average survival is often short. With multiplex imaging we aim to identify spatial characteristic that could help us better understand the disease and patient response.

Waypoints.Name: T cell
Waypoints.Description: T cells can have both pro-tumour and anti-tumour activity. It is known that their location within the tumour microenvironment can impact their function and subsequently impact patient outcomes.

Waypoints.Name: Tumour metabolism
Waypoints.Description: Altered cellular metabolism is a hallmark feature of cancer, affecting the way that the cancer cells can evade the immune system. Uptake in glucose indicates higher liklihood of growth and proliferation. Depending on the combination of proteins dysregulated, different metabolic pathways could be activated -- resulting in the potential excretion of toxic waste products into the TME and impairing functions of immune cells.
